page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: This is a sparsely populated farming area. The land varies from sea level at the river Bervie in the South, to 150 metres on the hills to the north-east.There is a church dating from the 13th century, a hall, playing field, a former school, a general shop and sub-Post Office, and a telephone kiosk. A volunteer bus service runs to Stonehaven on Friday mornings. There are two main roads through the area, several small roads and a right of way.There are woods beside the river, otherwise the ground is open,the fields bounded by fences.
